alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Dauphin; Franklin; Lancaster; Lebanon; Perry; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 26 at 5:36AM EDT until July 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 8 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values mainly between 100 and 104 degrees expected. Some locations could see the heat index top out at 105 to 107 degrees. * WHERE...Franklin, Perry, Dauphin, Lebanon, Cumberland, Adams, York and Lancaster Counties. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to 8 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Excessive Heat can be life-threatening among at-risk populations, such as children, the elderly, and those with pre-existing health conditions.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay out of the sun, and stay in an air-conditioned room. Check up on relatives and neighbors, and provide pets with adequate water and shelter from the sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes. LOOK BEFORE YOU LOCK. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Individuals overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1. For excessive heat safety information, visit weather.gov/heat. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
